It can depend on the specific context and the individuals involved, but some common affectations that people may naturally pick up quickly include:

1. Speech patterns: This can include accent, tone of voice, and use of colloquialisms. People may adopt the speech patterns of those around them in order to fit in or to communicate more effectively.
2. Gestures and body language: People may adopt the gestures and body language of those around them in order to express themselves more clearly or to fit in with a group.
3. Diction: Diction includes the way of pronunciation, words usage, and variations in pronunciation.
4. Dress and appearance: People may adopt certain styles of dress or grooming in order to fit in with a group or to present themselves in a certain way.
5. Interaction styles: People may adopt certain ways of interacting with others, such as patterns of communication or social etiquette, in order to fit in with a group or to present themselves in a certain way.
6. Vocabulary: People may adopt new words, phrases, or jargon in order to fit in with a group or to communicate more effectively.

It's worth noting that these affectations can also be picked up by being part of a specific culture, family, and educational background as well.
